alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cumberland, central Salem and southwestern Gloucester Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodstown, or 12 miles southeast of Wilmington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Bridgeton, Woodstown, Alloway, Newfield, Elmer, Shiloh, Olivet, Seabrook Farms, Rosenhayn and Centerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
